newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Trade in Brazil Banespa to resume Friday.
newsitem.headline: Trade in Brazil Banespa to resume Friday.

text.p: Trade in shares of Sao Paulo state bank Banespa will resume Friday, said a spokesman for Sao Paulo Stock Exchange (Bovespa).

Trade in Banespa, which had been suspended since Tuesday, will resume after it sent a statement clarifying the sale of Sao Paulo state's 51 percent stake in the bank to the federal government for a price to be determined after one year.
The sale was announced Wednesday by Sao Paulo state governor Mario Covas and federal officials as part of a major refinancing deal for Sao Paulo's massive debt.

While in federal hands for one year, the bank will be run by an independent manager which will be selected in a bidding process. A group of eight officials, made up of four state representatives and four federal officials, next week will begin to work together to prepare the bidding process and ready Banespa for the new administration.
Although government officials have declined to say whether the bank will be privatized after the one-year period expires, most observers say the bank's fate is the sell-off.
Banespa, Brazil's largest state bank, has been under Central Bank special administration since December 1994.
